724590f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Fulton Street
724590f-a.text:
West Street, east side, from Fulton (right) to Vesey (left) Street's, showing the westerly portions of the Washington Market, a municipal structure that occupies the entire block east to Washington Street. Erected in 1883-4 on the site of the Washington Market of 1812, the Buttermilk Market of 1792, and the Bear Market of 1771, it is to be improved according to an extensive historical
article in the Times of October 27, 1940.
In the background are the spires of the Woolworth and
the Municipal Buildings.
About 1915
H. N. Tiemann, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection
724590f-a.folder: West Street & Fulton Street, Manhattan, NY

724589f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Fulton Street
724589f-a.text:
West Street, west side, at the foot of Fulton Street, showing the
entrance to pier No. 14, North (Hudson) River.
July 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
724589f-a.folder: West Street & Fulton Street, Manhattan, NY

724587f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Fulton Street
724587f-a.text:
(1)
West Street, east side, at Fulton Street. Also shown is Fulton Street, east from West Street. The view shows the Washington Market on the left, with the Woolworth Building in the background.
May 5, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2) The same, a further view southward. Also shown is Fulton Street, south side, east from West, to and including Washington
Streets.
July 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
724587f-a.folder: West Street & Fulton Street, Manhattan, NY

724588f-a.title: Manhattan: West Street - Fulton Street
724588f-a.text:
West Street, east side, south from Fulton Street, showing the various buildings fringing this marginal thoroughfare and facing the Hudson River. To the left are the outstanding skyscrapers constituting the downtown skyline. Intermingled are the Hudson Terminal, Singer, Ecuitable, Bank of Manhattan, Bank of New Tork, and Irving Trust buildinas. The latter is nearly completed in the earlier view.
1: July 26, 1930
2: July 1. 1933
P. L. Sperr
724588f-a.folder: West Street & Fulton Street, Manhattan, NY
